result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy Ray Brown Jr

records.addlTxt: Request from counsel to reschedule motion hearing on companion case to accommodate officers that will be testifying; matter reset to 12/1/2022 at 11:00 am

Defendant Billy Ray Brown Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Billy Ray Brown Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Amy Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Defense has received global offer from the State and will be filing a Motion to Suppress regarding the  defendant's other pending case before this court and will not proceed with plea hearing at this time.  This matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 7/11/2022  (7 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.
The 5/13/22 Cash Bond Posted entry is incorrect.  The $4,000.00 bail does not belong to this case.  sb

Defendant Billy Ray Brown in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a Plea hearing date be scheduled.  Court schedules this for Plea Hearing. 

Defense requests refund of overage of bond.  No objection by the State.  Court ORDERS refund of cash bond on deposit in amount over $500.00 be returned to person who posted it.  Defendant is advised that all conditions of Bail remain in effect.

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Billy Ray Brown in court by video with Attorney Robert J Hampton who appears in person.  Edward O'Brien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Billy Ray Brown in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 8/01/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/11/22 @ 1p
